Package ui

Class InputMenu

java.lang.Object
ui.Menu
ui.InputMenu
public class InputMenu extends Menu
Class extending Menu that adds the option of prompting the user for input for object creation.

The menu can be created through the use of method chaining.

Inputs and any callbacks are passed to the menu before the UI runs the menu. Each relevant input will be stored in a HashMap, which will then get passed to the given callback function (inputFinishEventRunnable) for handling the resultant data

addValidationRequest() can be used to prompt the user to verify the data is correct.

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Isaac Fleetwood
See Also:
UIManager

    • addValidationRequest

      public InputMenu addValidationRequest()
      Sets validationRequest to true. When the menu is run, the user will be prompted to verify that the data they entered is correct. If they say it isn't they will be given the option to try again or exit the menu without creating anything.
      Returns:

    • runMenu

      public void runMenu()
      Runs the menu. Prints out all headings then prompts the user for input based on the inputs given beforehand.

      If addValidationRequest() was ran beforehand, it will call requestValidation() to make the user verify the data is correct.

      If addValidationRequest() was never ran, or requestValidation() returns ValidationState.CONTINUE then inputFinishEventRunnable will be ran with the HashMap containing the data from the input.

      Specified by:
      runMenu in class Menu
      Parameters:
      None - - However, it will use the previous data given via methods like addInput(String, String) addHeading(String) and addValidationRequest(). If you are having problems, verify those methods are giving the correct data.
